author: Minja Eveliina
comment: Not a bad app, but it could be so much more. The ability to only choose running as an exercise is very limiting. I had to install Google Fit just so I could track my other workouts. The heart rate tracker seems fairly consistent and accurate, which is a plus. Recently I have noticed that my active burn calories have not been recording at all. Even after exercising for an hour, I sit at "0 active calories burned". I do not rely on the calorie counter, so this is more of annoyance since it used to work.

author: Greg Lawrence
comment: App keeps turning my android wear tracking off on its own. It will work for a week and then stop tracking heart rate. When I load app on phone, the option to stop tracking on Android wear will be selected, even when I never manually select it. Frustrating.

author: Erin Schmid
comment: Gives me ten minutes of heart activity for a 45 minute insanity workout and still somehow gives me thirty minutes for a thirty minute light jog. I checked my heart rate with the app a few times during the workout and it seemed to be correct but it wasn't registering it at activity. I've posted this complaint before (a year ago) and nothing has been done to fix it.
title: Useless for heart rate

author: Shelly Stuart
comment: Steps are about half of what my Fitbit used to say. Heart activity is also way off. Did 20 minutes on a spin bike with my heart rate near its max and the app only counted it for 5 minutes.
title: Broken

author: Natusha Lewis
comment: The Moto Body fails to detect accurate heart rate or correct steps taken.  I am very disappointed that my old Fit Bit and even Google Fit is more reliable than my Moto 360. Very disappointed in the development of this application.
title: Doesn't Give Accurate Feedback

author: Scott Richardson
comment: There needs to be more options to accurately gauge your activity other than just running. People do other workouts other than just running. I have to migrate my workouts to Google Fit to accurately track my activity. It does the job but if you're going to half ass it, might as well allow Google to develop your apps for your Moto 360 Sport.
title: Needs improvements

author: Michael Backo
comment: In my opinion the latest update ruined the program. No longer shares information with Google Fit as it used to. Forces you to use their program to track your steps.  No longer can you have fit and body on your Moto 360 Sport, only Moto Body. I should be able to choose what I want to use as I used to be able to.

author: Chrissi Levin
comment: It was great in the beginning, but now my watch and this app are not talking to each other. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling, shutting both down and reopening but nothing seems to help! Very frustrating!!!

author: Kirsten Hoogstraten
comment: I was excited for this to track my heart activity, but it doesn't at all! It only happened the night I went out dancing. When I go to the gym it doesn't work at all. Good thing I have Under Armour Record.
title: Doesn't track a thing

author: Neil Myrick
comment: This app leaves allot to be desired. For instance, the ONLY workout listed is running. No weight lifting, no road cycling, no stationary bike, nothing.
title: Half assed fitness app

author: Kevin Lairson
comment: I have a moto 360 watch and run every other day, never syncs my runs. I see it on my watch but open the app it shows steps heart rate, everything but my run. And yes everything is set up correctly. See ya getting a Fitbit.
title: Junk

author: Kelsey Salmans
comment: Only reason I got this app is because I had to for my moto 360. It is the default app for the initial watch settings. There are no options for other types of exercises than running and I NEVER run, but I do other exercises such as weights, kick boxing, etc. Also says that it will link with my previous fitbit account but it doesn't. I would be willing to give this app a second try if a total overhaul was done.
title: Very unimpressive

author: Mike Bobo
comment: This app has made great improvement since it's initial launch. Lately however my summary stats have been way off.  I made all 3 of my goals 6 out of 7 days last week. My step goals should have a streak of about 50 days but the streak count doesn't match the actual numbers. According to the streak count I only made my goals one day last week. I also haven't received the email summary in over 1 month! Knocking this down to  3 stars. Needs improvement.

reply.author: Motorola Mobility LLC.
reply.content: Hi!  Thanks very much for your feedback - we're always looking to improve Moto Body.  Our latest version of the app actually allows you to customize your daily goals.  You can check it out in Settings, Goals.  Tap on the "Daily steps goal" and you'll see the option to update the goal, as you please.  Hope this helps!

author: Gautam Lakum
comment: Syncing with the Moto 360 watches works well. But missing the motivation factor. App looks a bit boring with the UI & UX.

author: T W
comment: The heart rate monitor will take readings manually and it seems to take readings on its own on a somewhat regular basis. However, the heart activity log doesn't do anything. Yesterday I worked out, with my heart rate consistently up, for 45 minutes. It didn't register a thing. Today, I've been in my exercise bike for nearly half an hour now. Nada. I was really excited to get my Moto 360 but the official fitness software it comes with is a real let down.
title: Zero heart activity no matter what I do.

author: Rob Ross
comment: I have a G4 Plus and a Moto 360 watch and for some reason the watch data isn't syncing to the phone at all. I've gone through the settings and it should be working. LeMoto needs to take another whack at this app because it ain't working right. It doesn't track my heart activity at all.
title: Not working at all.

author: Miles Henderson
comment: Unreliable and randomly deleted all of my previous data. Good thing I also tracked using Google fit.
title: Stopped counting steps

author: Jean Baptiste
comment: Works very well on the Moto 360 Sport, apart the syncing to Strava, which happens only half of the time. Plus, it's impossible to export a GPX or TCX file from my outdoor activities from the phone app, or to initiate a resync to Strava, meaning my data is locked inside the app and unusable. Did anyone manage to extract their own GPS data from the app?  Feature suggestion: it would be useful to have the current track mapped on the watch, just like what Ghostracer does, and what TomTom's "route exploration" feature does on the Spark3

author: Paul Wills
comment: I have to use moto body for things that Google fit doesn't do (target heart rate exercises) and Google fit for things that moto doesn't do (basically everything else).  App really needs more than "indoor run" for exercise options.
title: Hate that I need two apps

author: Tony Cordina
comment: Great stats available when used with moto 360 gen 2 smart watch but only  offers indoor run unless you have the 360 sport  as this watch has built in GPS. Shame as most connected phone do have reliable GPS why can't this be included do you want us to by two watches? That said everything else woks and is very intuitive.

author: Matt Laskowski
comment: I recently got a Moto 360 Sport, and I have a Note 5 phone. Both phone and watch are updated to their most recent software versions. When playing music through Google Play Music (on my phone) the audio stutters once every 15 seconds or so. It stutters even if the 360 is disconnected / Bluetooth off. I uninstalled Moto Body and the problem disappeared. Any ideas what's causing this?
title: Samsung Note5 + 360 Sport Breaks Audio

author: Brandon Reed
comment: **EDIT.. What formula do they use to calculate calories? Where the heck do they get those numbers, their crazy way off. No good. Wish i could rate -5. Worst purchase ever.   Not very helpful. If your going to get in the fitness game you should probably do it right. You can only set one goal to track, the graphs are very limited on what they show making it almost impossible to improve, and its just very limited and difficult to read. I regret buying the Moto 360 Sport because of this apps limited function. Waste of money, I'll end up with a Samsung i guess

author: Arijit Ray
comment: Dated UI. Need to update to give better view. Also, info displayed is mostly wrong. It counts steps even if I'm sitting.
title: UI is dated

author: Arun S Gopalaswami
comment: This app does only bare minimum stuff. It does not support complex excersies, not even elliptical routine. Needs to go a long way to be competitive.

author: Jessica Desiree
comment: Issues with it constantly popping up on my watch face saying I made my steps goal. Will rate better when fixed.

author: Dan corrigan
comment: The app is nicely designed and works well but I think it needs more features,  if it also tracked your sleep (just a simple estimate of how long you slept) and let you input your food+water intake for the day it would be perfect.. it wouldn't have to be on the level of MyFitnessPal for food tracking but just an option to keep a simple log of the food/water you consumed. These features are available on other wearable devices and I think it would make my Moto 360 Sport more useful as a fitness gadget.
title: Needs to do more!

author: Kelly Haan
comment: Sometimes it does not capture that I'm working out, or notice increases in heart rate. There also isn't a bike setting (only steps) so when I bike it's very inaccurate.

author: vatsal ladia
comment: All it does is pathetically tells me same exact calorie i burn every day, steps doesn't sync heart activity doesn't sync, the watch is keeping track hut doesn't sync.....bs app ....0
title: Doesn't sync with moto 360 at all

author: Ryan Jones
comment: This app no longer logs activity or sends email on my droid Maxx since last update in January.  This needs to be fixed since this app is now useless.

author: Steven Killeen
comment: Feedback - I have had bugs with my Moto Body app in the past leading to inaccurate data. The ability to delete inaccurate days/weeks/months would be pretty helpful.

author: Akshay Patkar
comment: Inefficient. Just a good gadget. No fitness tracker
title: Not accurate

author: don albertson
comment: The Heart Activity feature is flakey. There's no indication of what the threshold for "activity" is and no way to set it. Counts activity when I'm sitting still and ignores even when it says the rate is 135. One morning I was biking for 45 minutes, Google Fit -- which uses the same sensor -- showed an average rate of 96bpm and as much as 145bpm and this moronic program said I only had 5 minutes of "activity". If I had no heart activity, I'd be dead.
title: It's not just weird, it's demented.

author: Danielle Henderson
comment: All of a sudden today, it stopped syncing with my Under Armour apps. I tried to reauthorization and it is stating my login and password is incorrect when I know it's right. I event changed my password just to be sure and that's not working either. I don't know what the problem is, but it needs to get fixed. I depend on this for my workouts.

author: Nancy Brandes
comment: Bad app if youn want to see your steps very INACCURATE when calculating. If I could losd shealth I would pull this from my watch. It is terrible and does not recognise heart activity that well too.

author: KETUL SHAH
comment: It should also have sleep tracking too. As the ather things its best

Appears that most recent update to either moto body or android wear has broken the step counter for moto. No steps are registering but my calorie count is off the charts today.  I can only assume steps are going to the calorie count erroneously.

author: Robert Boschman
comment: Why does it tell me every Monday that I only meet my goals 1 day the previous week and to try for 2 this week, when I exceed my goals 6 or 7 days every week?  Just a minor irritation but makes me hate it.

author: Evan Radecki
comment: When uploading to Google fit, the data is completely wrong. One time I went on a 6 mile run and after sending it to Google fit, it said it was 9 miles. Please fix this because it is very annoying to have to manually change the run every time.

author: Ivo Oliveira
comment: This app is already 10 months since last version came out. It still does not support altimeter reading from Moto 360 Sport. Will it have a new version anytime soon?

author: Mike Hillyard
comment: Liked the app for first week although it is quite basic. However on second week heart rate is no longer monitoring so not sure what has happened and checked all settings. Having looked at review I am not the only complainant, please fix. Thanks.
